page.title: 11Recreation-N.Nibley.
page.content: For recreation many people spend their time on Stinchcombe Hill playing golf, walking along the Cotswold Way or visiting the Tyndale Monument.North Nibley has its own football club with 4 teams,the age groups ranging from under 12s to the seniors.A new field is needed as they use a farmer's field.The cricket team use a hay field which is a disadvantage as they have to delay play until the hay is harvested.A swimming pool is also needed as the nearest are in Stroud, Thornbury or Gloucester.Most of the sports are played at the Dursley sports centre.Some people attend the Dursley and District Athletics club which coaches track,field and cross country events.Another popular pastime is horse riding although there are no riding schools in the area.
